item.title: Welcome to the Archive
item.description: I’m no stranger to making bad posts. That sort of thing happens to the best of us from time to time. A misinformed take, a misplaced sentiment, a misspoken thought. Sometimes you make something that doesn’t need to be made. Sometimes you’re just flat-out wrong about something. This section of the website is basically a quarantine zone for all the times where I’ve done exactly that. I don’t want the works found here to be publicly distributed, necessarily, but I think it’s worth keeping them somewhere on the website if only for the sake of honesty and clarity.

item.title: NIKKE: First Impressions
item.description: This one’s easy. The piece on Goddess of Victory: NIKKE is here because, to be quite frank, I didn’t give the game its due diligence. Now, that’s not to say that I actually think the game is good or anything - far from it. As I point out in the article itself, I’m not the target audience for these kinds of games… and that’s kind of the problem. I wasn’t really willing to properly engage with the game and its systems, and so I didn’t spend much time bothering to actually learn how the game worked when I played it, and that combined with a few people in my circles comparing it to popular rail shooters just didn’t leave me well-equipped to assess the game with much in the way of intellectual honesty or factual accuracy.

item.title: Study Guide for Sarah Bryant - VF4FT
item.description: This post was originally written shortly after Virtua Fighter 4 Final Tuned had made its way onto Fightcade with rollback netcode. I was really interested in learning Sarah Bryant in that game, and while the resources certainly existed on VFDC, they were somewhat scattered and written in a very of-the-time style. I wrote this to be a kind of “cleaned up” and more central version of those resources, but when VFDC ended up adding VF4FT proper to its self-hosted wiki, I felt like keeping this up in public would have been stepping on some toes a little bit.

item.title: Hidden Dead or Alive 2 Ayane Notes
item.description: Okay, full disclosure: this was never really made public to begin with. I wrote it in the lead-up to a Dead or Alive 2 tournament that Fraud Krew hosted back in 2022, and rather than risk the Australian Connection on a largely US tournament, I decided to lab out Ayane and see what I could find in the hope that maybe someone else could use this information in my stead.
